title: How to Get a Towed Car Back Without Paying

steps.title: Call your local parking authority to find your car and get more information.
steps.content: Call your local parking authority to find your car and get more information. Provide your license plate number and your car’s make, model, and color, then ask why your car was towed and who towed it. The parking authority should have answers, although their database may take a few hours to update. Call your city’s non-emergency police number (like 311) for more information if the parking authority can’t answer all of your questions. [1] X Trustworthy Source Official UK government website Official website for the public sector of the UK government Go to source Ask business or apartment complex owners who they called to tow your vehicle if you were parked on their property. When in doubt, ask people in the area or passersby if they saw which towing company moved your car. Don’t call 911 to ask about a towed car. It’s considered a waste of emergency resources and may be illegal (look for your jurisdiction's Non-emergency police number instead).

steps.title: Check whether your car was rightly or wrongly towed.
steps.content: Check whether your car was rightly or wrongly towed. If you were towed for illegal parking, scan the area for signage—if you don’t see signs with parking information, you can contest the charges. Take photos of the scene as proof to back up your claim to police, city officials, and the towing company. [2] X Trustworthy Source Official UK government website Official website for the public sector of the UK government Go to source If you were towed from an apartment complex or business, file a complaint with the owners or managers and ask for the reason you were towed.

steps.title: Research whether the towing company is predatory or compliant.
steps.content: Research whether the towing company is predatory or compliant. Some municipalities oversee car towing to keep tow yards from engaging in abusive operations. Search for your city’s parking and towing laws online—make sure you get information from an official website ending in “.gov” or “.org.” [3] X Trustworthy Source Official UK government website Official website for the public sector of the UK government Go to source If you can prove you were wrongfully or illegally towed, you likely won’t have to pay to retrieve your car. If the tow company is proven guilty of illegal or exploitative behavior, they might face a large fine and you could receive additional compensation.

steps.title: Contact local law enforcement to order the return of your vehicle.
steps.content: Contact local law enforcement to order the return of your vehicle. Be certain you’ve done nothing wrong—if you’re guilty of violating a parking law or regulation, the police can’t order the tow yard to return your car. Typically, the most police can do is request that the tow yard reconsider or act as a go-between for you and the towing company. [4] X Trustworthy Source Civil Law Help Center Nonprofit law firm dedicated to civil legal services to all people Go to source Remember that tow yards and companies are businesses that can work with law enforcement as well.

steps.title: Follow your city’s procedure for filing complaints against towing.
steps.content: Follow your city’s procedure for filing complaints against towing. If your complaint is valid, you’ll potentially have your towing and impound fees waived. Dispute any tickets that led to your car being towed, too. Show they were issued in error with photos or other evidence. [5] X Research source If you prove you were forced to violate a parking regulation or other law due to extenuating or emergency circumstances, a court may waive your fees. File your claim or request a hearing as soon as possible. There is typically a limited number of days after the incident when your complaint will be valid. Some cities require you to request a hearing in-person and/or in writing. Check your city’s official website ending in “.gov” or “.org.”

steps.title: Free legal services will assist you if the tow company is unfair.
steps.content: Free legal services will assist you if the tow company is unfair. Typically, pro bono legal resources are reserved for low-income individuals or families that don’t have the money or assets to get their car back. Use resources like LawHelp.org to find pro bono legal opportunities in your state. [6] X Trustworthy Source Civil Law Help Center Nonprofit law firm dedicated to civil legal services to all people Go to source Free legal services will likely not help if your car was impounded due to criminal activity.

steps.title: Some tow companies offer financing to help retrieve impounded cars.
steps.content: Some tow companies offer financing to help retrieve impounded cars. Call the lot and explain your situation—they may recommend or offer you a loan, or suggest a payment plan where you pay the tow and storage fees in installments. Your options depend on the individual lot’s policies. [7] X Research source The interest rates of tow yard payment plans are usually high. However, this could be a good option if you need your car back quickly and don’t have the money up front.

steps.title: Local nonprofits, charities, or churches might assist with fees.
steps.content: Local nonprofits, charities, or churches might assist with fees. Explain your situation to one of these programs—if you need your vehicle for work and are struggling financially, you may receive a small grant or low-interest loan to help you get your car back. [8] X Research source Provide proof of employment and income plus a plan to repay the money when you apply for aid through a nonprofit organization or similar program. These organizations might also locate low-income car loans, offer help registering your vehicle, or assist with paying off outstanding tickets. Some organizations, like churches or charities, may ask for volunteer hours or another commitment in exchange for financial assistance. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Lean on your friends, family, or social networks for financial support.
steps.content: Lean on your friends, family, or social networks for financial support. Explain how the storage fees add up every day and fast action is necessary to lower the cost of getting your car back. To reach more people, set up an online crowdfunding effort through a free site like GoFundMe . [10] X Research source If you plan on repaying friends or family, secure a loan as soon as possible to reduce the amount you’ll have to pay back. If friends and family can’t help, ask them to share your crowdfunding link to reach as many people as possible.

steps.title: Use the loan to get your car back if you’re currently strapped for cash.
steps.content: Use the loan to get your car back if you’re currently strapped for cash. You’ll ultimately still end up paying to retrieve your car, but a loan may be worth it since the storage fees add up every day. Compare the cost of the loan to the cost of impoundment to decide whether getting a payday loan is the best move. [11] X Research source Payday loans are cash advance loans that typically have high interest rates and fees. Use a payday loan as a short-term fix if your car impoundment is an emergency.

steps.title: Retrieve your car with the title loan money, then repay the loan later.
steps.content: Retrieve your car with the title loan money, then repay the loan later. In this arrangement, the title to your car is the collateral. Repay the loan on time to get the title back, minimize interest charges, and prevent the lender from selling your car to get their money back. [12] X Research source You may have to swap the hard copy of your title to get the loan.
